TopicTitle: Why are Kerbals born with helmets?

Articles.Content:
Why is it that Kerbals are born with such helmets, maybe its because there are some non lethal yet horrific side effects of being exposed to the vacuum of space such as redness of the eyes and yellowing of the skin.

PLEASE READ THIS

Did you enjoy this picture and my other picture Too much lsd Jeb if you did please comment and if you feel like I should make more images send me a message and maybe even some suggestions, JAMERICA OUT!

1: The image is broken

2: I think they're born with helmets because the space suit is a part of their body.

Let's not forget George W. Kerman: Born with a silver helmet in his mouth!
Well, Kerbal's aren't born with helmets, or space suits. you can see the ground crews in the Vehicle Assembly Building, and the SpacePlane Hanger without the suits.
It's true, a Kerbal exposed to vacuum is not a happy kerbal. More of a dead kerbal.
Kerbals are not born with helmets.

Hey hey hey watch secrets of the kerbiverse you will understand it all in time my child now drink soup... drink soup.

That was the least accurate video for the Kerbal Universe I have seen, Take a look here, and grasp out of your current mentality

http://play.kerbalroleplay.com/index.php

Im sorry to tell you but when a baby kerbal is launched out of the womb all you see is a disgusting tiny creature in a simple extra vehicular activity (E.V.A.) suit just open your eyes.

(P.S. the kerbalizer is plastic surgery for kerbals the e.v.a. suit is not required to live unless in the vacuum of space.)

Discrepancy A: Kerbals Reproduce Asexually, the devs have clearly said there are no genders for Kerbals

Discrepancy B: Kerbals are NOT disgusting.... Silly

I say again, this site says all http://play.kerbalroleplay.com/index.php

(P.S. Grammar nao!)
So glad this is on it's way out

B. I never said they were disgusting... Silly-Billy
